Title: Everyone Deserves the Right to Breathe Smoke-free Air
Overview:
There is no such thing as safe levels of secondhand smoke – it contains more than 70 cancer-causing chemicals and is a danger to us all.  South Bend’s Common Council recently chose to delay voting on a measure that would protect workers and families from the dangers of secondhand smoke making us all wait for a healthier South Bend.  On July 14 the Council has the opportunity to be a leader in St. Joseph County and vote for a smoke-free South Bend. 

Tell the South Bend Common Council that everyone deserves the right to breathe smoke-free air and it’s time to protect workers and families in South Bend.
Signature Count: There is no such thing as safe levels of secondhand smoke  period.  Secondhand smoke contains 70 cancer-causing chemicals and is a danger to us all. Its time to protect all workers and families from the dangers of secondhand smoke.

Petition ID: Recently  South Bend had the opportunity to be a leader for St. Joseph County by protecting workers and families from secondhand smoke and making a healthier South Bend for all of us.  Instead  a few council members chose to delay a smoke-free South Bend  making us all wait for a safer  healthier South Bend and St. Joseph County.

On July 14  this issue will be up for another vote.  Smoke-free air is important for all of us  and we strongly urge you to support a smoke-free South Bend this July because everyone deserves the right to breathe smoke-free air.
Image URL: American Cancer Society Cancer Action Network - Indiana
